title: [ES1.1] Create Emergence Scenario Base Class
body: Define a reusable base class for all emergence scenarios with hooks for detection, clustering, and visualization.

title: [ES1.2] Implement cluster detection utilities
body: Add density-based cluster detection for tracking emergent groupings in N-body or substrate-augmented simulations.

title: [ES1.3] Implement symmetry detection tools
body: Detect rotational, reflectional, and translational symmetries to identify emergent ordered behavior.

title: [ES1.4] Add phase-transition detector
body: Create detection logic to identify transitions between ordered, chaotic, and clustered states.

title: [ES1.5] Add bifurcation visualization mode
body: Visualize bifurcations as system parameters change, including energy sweeps and topology transitions.

title: [ES1.6] Add multi-run scenario sweeper
body: Create tool to run multiple scenario variants with parameter sweeps to discover emergent regimes.

title: [ES1.7] Add emergence overlays for Python viewer
body: Integrate overlays showing clusters, symmetry axes, and emergent features.

title: [ES1.8] Implement initial-condition randomizer
body: Provide templated generators for chaotic, quasi-stable, clustered, and symmetry-breaking initial conditions.

title: [ES1.9] Build emergence scenario library
body: Create a library of preconfigured emergence scenarios for teaching and testing.

title: [ES1.R] Add attractor mapping module
body: Prototype attractor mapping by analyzing long-term recurring states or stable loops.

title: [ES2.1] Reaction–diffusion Turing pattern scenario
body: Simulate substrate-based Turing patterns driven by interacting scalar fields.

title: [ES2.2] Field-driven cluster formation scenario
body: Demonstrate cluster emergence driven by substrate gradient forces.

title: [ES2.3] Topology-induced symmetry breaking scenario
body: Create scenarios where topology transitions create new emergent patterns.

title: [ES2.4] Wave–particle interaction scenario
body: Simulate emergent oscillations where substrate waves affect particle dynamics.

title: [ES2.5] Pressure-gradient substrate scenario
body: Model pressure-like substrate forces influencing collective behavior.

title: [ES2.6] Emergent oscillatory modes scenario
body: Identify feedback loops that create collective oscillations.

title: [ES2.R] Heatmap-based attractor visualizer
body: Visualize emergent attractors using substrate-field heatmaps.

title: [ES3.1] AI-assisted anomaly detector
body: Use machine-learning or rule-based heuristics for detecting unphysical or emergent anomalies.

title: [ES3.2] Emergent pattern classifier
body: Classify run outputs as clustered, chaotic, oscillatory, or symmetric.

title: [ES3.3] LLM-based emergence explainer
body: Use LLM-generated natural language to explain detected emergent patterns.

title: [ES3.4] Run-quality scoring system
body: Score simulations on stability, coherence, noise, and emergent structure strength.

title: [SS1.1] Implement substrate grid structure
body: Create a scalar field grid supporting arbitrary resolution and domain shape.

title: [SS1.2] Add discrete Laplacian operator
body: Implement Laplacian stencil for diffusion-style substrate updates.

title: [SS1.3] Implement substrate boundary conditions
body: Support periodic, reflective, and open boundaries for substrate simulations.

title: [SS1.4] Add substrate evolution integrator
body: Implement explicit and semi-implicit integrators for substrate updates.

title: [SS1.5] Substrate field visualization overlay
body: Add heatmap rendering layer for substrate fields in Python viewer.

title: [SS1.6] Substrate JSON exporter
body: Export substrate fields to single-file JSON and multi-frame exports.

title: [SS1.7] Web Viewer substrate loader
body: Enable substrate importing and rendering in the Three.js viewer.

title: [SS1.8] Field compression / downsampling pipeline
body: Implement lossy/lossless compression for substrate fields during export.

title: [SS2.1] Particle→Field deposit model
body: Implement rules for particles influencing substrate fields (density, impulses).

title: [SS2.2] Field→Particle force model
body: Allow substrate gradients to apply forces on particles.

title: [SS2.3] Substrate advection model
body: Add ability for fields to be advected by dynamic flows.

title: [SS2.4] Substrate-curvature mapping
body: Use substrate density or gradients to inform topology curvature effects.

title: [SS2.5] Substrate diagnostics layer
body: Add field stability metrics, spectral analysis, and diffusion rates.

title: [SS2.6] Substrate–particle interaction overlays
body: Viewer overlays showing where substrate forces affect particle motion.

title: [SS2.R] Substrate-driven curvature visualizer
body: Visualize topology deformation implied by substrate density.

title: [SS3.1] GPU substrate solver
body: Accelerate substrate grid updates using CUDA/XLA.

title: [SS3.2] Multi-GPU substrate tiling
body: Partition substrate grid across multiple GPUs.

title: [SS3.3] Adaptive-resolution substrate grids
body: Support multi-resolution grids for efficiency and zooming.

title: [SS3.4] Shader-based field visualization
body: Render substrate fields with GPU shaders in the web viewer.

title: [SS3.5] XLA-optimized field operators
body: Optimize Laplacian and advection operators using XLA fusion.

title: [SS3.R] Prototype GPU fluid solver
body: Implement early GPU-accelerated Navier–Stokes solver.

title: [Viz3.1] Add vector-field visualization
body: Render vector fields representing substrate gradients or flow.

title: [Viz3.2] Add manifold curvature renderer
body: Render curvature maps for topologies or substrate-driven curvature.

title: [Viz3.3] Add multi-pane comparison viewer
body: Allow simultaneous comparisons of physics, substrate, and topology behavior.

title: [Viz3.4] Add 4D projection viewer
body: Render trajectories using time as a projection dimension.

title: [Viz3.5] Add raymarching topology renderer
body: Use raymarching to visualize curved manifolds and fields.

title: [Viz3.6] Add dynamic warped-grid visualization
body: Render warped grids that respond to substrate gradient fields.

title: [Viz3.R] Add unified overlay selector UI
body: Provide UI for toggling particle, field, topology, and emergence overlays.
